channel.title: UCSC on xiaoni's blog
channel.description: Recent content in UCSC on xiaoni's blog

item.title: Data from mRNA lncRNA and miRNA and match clinical information with R from UCSC Xena
item.description:
It’s very convenient to get datasets from UCSC Xena. Normally, datasets will need to be processed and transformed with R language.

Herein, I will recover the protocol of datasets processed.

item.title: UCSC gene browser with R package Gviz - part 2
item.description: Continued, in this present, to draw the customized UCSC gene Track With Gviz package.

item.title: UCSC gene browser with R package Gviz - part 1
item.description: Gviz, Visualize genomic data. Let’s dive into it to explore useful functions.

item.title: UCSC Xena Features: Genomic Signatures
item.description: Genomic signatures, sometimes expressed as a weighted sum of genes, are an algebra over genes.

item.title: UCSC Xena: Private and Public Data Put Together
item.description: Put private data and public Xena Data together via UCSC Xena Hub .

item.title: Local UCSC Xena Data Hub
item.description: Load the private data to Local Xena Data Hub.

item.title: UCSC Xena: Load Data From Public Database
item.description: Load and analysis data from publication resources, such as GEO.
